The text describes Aunt Polly nodding off while knitting in her combined bedroom/dining room on a pleasant summer day. When she inspects the fence, she is astonished to find Tom has not only completely whitewashed it, but coated it repeatedly and even added streaks to the ground. Aunt Polly compliments Tom's rare work ethic, saying he can work when he wants to, though admitting he seldom wants to. She then allows him to go play after completing the fence so diligently.
